title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine if events A and B are independent, we need to compare the probability of A and B occurring separately to the probability of them occurring together.

If events A and B are independent, then:

P(A AND B) $$=$$ P(A) × P(B)

However, in this case, we have:

P(A) $$=$$ $$0.4$$ and P(B) $$=$$ $$0.2$$

P(A AND B) $$=$$ $$0.08$$

We can calculate:

P(A) × P(B) $$=$$ $$0.4$$ × $$0.2$$ $$=$$ $$0.08$$

Since P(A AND B) $$=$$ P(A) × P(B), events A and B are independent.

This means that the probability of learning Spanish is not affected by the probability of learning German, and vice versa.
